name: Dog
description: Loyal domesticated companion, one of the most popular pets worldwide.

name: Cat
description: Independent and graceful domesticated feline.

name: Chicken
description: The most common domesticated bird raised for eggs and meat.

name: Cow
description: Large domesticated bovine raised for dairy and beef.

name: Sheep
description: Woolly domesticated ruminant kept for fleece and meat.

name: Pig
description: Intelligent domesticated animal raised for pork.

name: Horse
description: Large domesticated equine used for riding and work.

name: Goat
description: Hardy domesticated ruminant kept for milk and meat.

name: Duck
description: Waterfowl found on every continent except Antarctica.

name: Pigeon
description: Common urban bird found in cities worldwide.

name: Sparrow
description: Small passerine bird commonly seen near human habitation.

name: Rat
description: Highly adaptable rodent found globally near human settlements.

name: Fox
description: Cunning omnivorous canine found across the Northern Hemisphere.

name: Deer
description: Graceful herbivore known for antlered males.

name: Rabbit
description: Small herbivorous mammal with long ears and powerful hind legs.

name: Squirrel
description: Agile rodent known for hoarding nuts in trees.

name: Raccoon
description: Nocturnal mammal with a distinctive black face mask.

name: Hedgehog
description: Small spiny mammal that curls into a ball for defense.

name: Badger
description: Stocky burrowing mammal with distinctive facial markings.

name: Coyote
description: Adaptable canine native to North America.

name: Eagle
description: Powerful raptor and apex avian predator.

name: Owl
description: Nocturnal bird of prey with exceptional hearing and silent flight.

name: Beaver
description: Large rodent known for building dams and lodges.

name: Flamingo
description: Tall wading bird known for its pink plumage and one-legged stance.

name: Red Panda
description: Charming arboreal mammal native to the eastern Himalayas.

name: Koala
description: Arboreal marsupial that feeds exclusively on eucalyptus leaves.

name: Penguin
description: Flightless seabird adapted to life in cold waters.

name: Otter
description: Playful semi-aquatic mammal known for floating on its back.

name: Sloth
description: Slow-moving arboreal mammal found in Central and South America.

name: Chameleon
description: Color-changing lizard with independently moving eyes.

name: Porcupine
description: Large rodent covered in sharp protective quills.

name: Toucan
description: Tropical bird with an oversized colorful bill.

name: Capybara
description: The world's largest living rodent, native to South America.

name: Manta Ray
description: Majestic ocean giant with a wingspan up to 7 meters.

name: Platypus
description: Egg-laying mammal with a duck bill and venomous spur.

name: Seahorse
description: Unique fish where the male carries and births the young.

name: Armadillo
description: Armored mammal that can roll into a protective ball.

name: Wolf
description: Apex pack predator and ancestor of the domestic dog.

name: Snow Leopard
description: Elusive big cat adapted to the high mountains of Central Asia.

name: Pangolin
description: Scaly anteater and the world's most trafficked mammal.

name: Axolotl
description: Mexican salamander that retains larval features throughout life.

name: Narwhal
description: Arctic whale known for its long spiral tusk.

name: Okapi
description: Forest giraffe with zebra-striped legs, native to the Congo.

name: Clouded Leopard
description: Medium-sized wild cat with cloud-shaped spots, found in Southeast Asia.

name: Quokka
description: Small marsupial known as the happiest animal on Earth.

name: Cassowary
description: Large flightless bird with a casque and vibrant neck colors.

name: Gharial
description: Critically endangered fish-eating crocodilian with a narrow snout.

name: Saola
description: Rare forest-dwelling bovine discovered in Vietnam in 1992.

name: Fossa
description: Cat-like predator found only in Madagascar.

name: Aye-Aye
description: Nocturnal primate from Madagascar with an elongated middle finger.

name: Numbat
description: Striped marsupial anteater endemic to Western Australia.

name: Dugong
description: Gentle marine herbivore closely related to manatees.

name: Kakapo
description: Critically endangered flightless nocturnal parrot from New Zealand.

name: Vaquita
description: World's rarest marine mammal, fewer than 10 individuals remain.

name: Javan Rhino
description: One of the rarest large mammals on Earth, found only in Java.

name: Philippine Eagle
description: One of the largest and most powerful eagles in the world.

name: Amur Leopard
description: World's rarest big cat, found in the Russian Far East.

name: Sumatran Orangutan
description: Critically endangered great ape endemic to Sumatra.

name: Red Wolf
description: Critically endangered canid native to the southeastern United States.

name: Yangtze Finless Porpoise
description: Critically endangered freshwater porpoise from China's Yangtze River.

name: Northern Hairy-Nosed Wombat
description: One of the rarest mammals, with fewer than 300 individuals.

name: Cross River Gorilla
description: World's rarest great ape, found on the Nigeria-Cameroon border.

name: Hainan Gibbon
description: World's rarest primate with around 35 individuals remaining.
